description.narrative: Funding under this investment provides support through the United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF) to improve the availability, quality and use of data on children with disabilities. UNICEF will partner with the Washington Group on Disability Statistics (WG) to complete a set of survey questions to provide international standardised data on children with disabilities. This funding will also support the development of a second set of survey questions to understand the barriers and facilitators to children with disability accessing quality education. The survey is intended to be used to capture statistics on children with disability attending school and those who are not. Once completed these survey questions will be used to improve data collection on children with disabilities in UNICEF’s Multiple Indicator Cluster Survey (MICS), one of the largest global sources of internationally comparable data on the situation of children and women.
